Interface tictactoe.TicTacToe

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    tictactoe.TicTacToeModel
    public interface tictactoe.TicTacToe
    A single game of Tic Tac Toe, played on a three-by-three grid with two players, with the object of the game to achieve three markers in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. tictactoe.Player X goes first.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      tictactoe.Player[][] getBoard()
      Return the current game state, as a 2D array of tictactoe.Player.
      tictactoe.Player getMarkAt​(int r, int c)
      Return the current tictactoe.Player mark at a given row and column, or null if the position is empty.
      tictactoe.Player getTurn()
      Get the current turn, i.e., the player who will mark on the next call to move().
      tictactoe.Player getWinner()
      Return the winner of the game, or null if there is no winner.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Return whether the game is over.
      void move​(int r, int c)
      Execute a move in the position specified by the given row and column.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        void move​(int r,
          int c)
        Execute a move in the position specified by the given row and column.
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the intended move
        c - the column of the intended move
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the space is occupied or the position is otherwise invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game is over

      • getTurn

        tictactoe.Player getTurn()
        Get the current turn, i.e., the player who will mark on the next call to move().
        Returns:
        the tictactoe.Player whose turn it is

      • isGameOver

        boolean isGameOver()
        Return whether the game is over. The game is over when either the board is full, or one player has won.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise

      • getWinner

        tictactoe.Player getWinner()
        Return the winner of the game, or null if there is no winner. If the game is not over, returns null.
        Returns:
        the winner, or null if there is no winner

      • getBoard

        tictactoe.Player[][] getBoard()
        Return the current game state, as a 2D array of tictactoe.Player. A null value in the grid indicates an empty position on the board.
        Returns:
        the current game board

      • getMarkAt

        tictactoe.Player getMarkAt​(int r,
                 int c)
        Return the current tictactoe.Player mark at a given row and column, or null if the position is empty.
        Parameters:
        r - the row
        c - the column
        Returns:
        the player at the given position, or null if it's empty
